page.title: 06Borrowdale Peregrine Watch
page.content: The peregrine falcon is a large rare falcon.It catches anything up to the size of a goose.It's call is a loud shrill kek kek kek and a long scream.Sometimes it will kill a rabbit or a vole.We watch the nest because egg collectors and falconers steal the eggs or young.The watch is carried out from when the eggs are laid until the young birds fly.One person would watch for three hours until the next person came,unless you arrived at 9.30p.m.when you watched for nine hours.The watchers are all volunteers from the Keswick area.The eggs take approximately thirty days to incubate. When the eggs have hatched it takes a further seven weeks to fly.There are usually four eggs in a clutch.If someone tried to steal eggs the person on watch would go to the nearest phone.
